rComments: Your grade heavily depends on how much service you do. Start looking for places you'd like to volunteer at ahead of time, Franklin is open to you serving anywhere. His papers are very straightforward just read the articles and listen to the discussions. You get out what you put in, don't expect to do nothing and get an A, you won't.

Franklin Williams made my college experience. I took his class several times, culminating in an independent grant writing project. He helped me figure out that I love service and and how to get involved--just graduated and am now working for AmeriCorps. Thank you Franklin... you crazy dude.

If your just looking for an easy 2-3 credit class then skip this one. However, if your down for the homeless and helping others then this is by far the best class at UCSC. Franklin is hilarious and always makes the class fun and he has had a profound impact on my life.

Franklin, address him by his first name, is one of the best instructors at UCSC. His service learning class makes you want to help, especially watching his personal dedication to a number of issues. Great foundational knowledge of non-profit orgs. A hilarious man!
